Explainer_Text: FAR Part 1 sets the legal and procedural foundation for the FAR system. The proposed changes insert instability and remove stakeholder rights.

Specific Comments on FAR Part 1:

The changes to FAR Part 1 have created two severe unintended consequences for my small business.

(1) The "Regulatory Sunset" (FAR 1.109) creates perpetual instability. The federal marketplace requires predictability. The provision that all non-statutory regulations—including the "Rule of Two" and all socioeconomic set-aside programs—will expire every four years unless renewed introduces a level of uncertainty that is toxic to investment and will discourage small businesses from entering or remaining in the market.

(2) The removal of former Subpart 1.5, "Agency and Public Participation," silences our voice. This action does not comport with the Administrative Procedure Act, which guarantees public participation in rulemaking. The practical effect of removing the formal process before a new one is legally established is to strip stakeholders of their right to due process. An informal feedback website is not a legally sufficient substitute.

Recommendation:

Immediately halt the implementation of the RFO via class deviations and re-engage with this process through the proper, transparent, and legally mandated notice-and-comment rulemaking process.

Restore the public participation procedures formerly in Subpart 1.5.

Repeal FAR 1.109, the "Regulatory Sunset," entirely or, at a minimum, amend it to explicitly exempt all of FAR Part 19 and its implementing clauses from its scope to ensure program stability.
